intro: Brachyscome ciliaris var. grandiflora, commonly known as the showy brachyscome, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom from spring to autumn. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, providing a textured appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
